title: Ticket #4526: Remove unnecessary calls to fcntl for non-blocking
description:
There's a small amount of cleanup to do in our socket handling code to remove unnecessary setsockopt and fcntl calls.

In particular, we call fcntl to get the flags and then again to set the flags with O_NONBLOCK or'd on. If the socket is already non-blocking, setting the flags is not necessary.

We also invoke several TCP options on AF_FILE sockets when accepting from the shared port. We should silently drop SOL_TCP options for AF_FILE sockets.

Completely internal changes - no documentation needed.
